intro: Hypolepis capensis, commonly known as the African shield fern, is a perennial fern native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Davalliaceae and is characterized by its large, shield-shaped fronds that can grow up to 1 meter in length. The plant has a rhizomatous growth habit and thrives in moist, shaded environments. Its spores are produced on the underside of the fronds, and it is often cultivated for its ornamental value. Hypolepis capensis is well adapted to tropical and subtropical climates.
